DataElement.preferredName: Right Lymph Node Radioactivity Gamma Camera Measurement Counts per Minute Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value of the radioactivity at a lymph node right of an injection site and measured as counts per minute (CPM) using a gamma camera.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Right Lymph Node Radioactivity Gamma Camera Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection._The anatomic site at which a medication or a vaccine is injected._The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements._An instrument used in medicine to produce images of internal organs after the injection of a radioactive drug into the body, where the drug releases gamma rays. It is used especially in medical diagnostic scanning._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.:A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.:The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.

Property.preferredDefinition: An instrument used in medicine to produce images of internal organs after the injection of a radioactive drug into the body, where the drug releases gamma rays. It is used especially in medical diagnostic scanning. (Encarta Dictionary and Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary):Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: An instrument used in medicine to produce images of internal organs after the injection of a radioactive drug into the body, where the drug releases gamma rays. It is used especially in medical diagnostic scanning. (Encarta Dictionary and Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary)
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A unit of frequency expressed as the detection rate of ionization events per minute._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit of frequency expressed as the detection rate of ionization events per minute.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A unit of frequency expressed as a number of events per minute.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Gamma Camera CRF from Duke clinical trial in Rave.
